title: Paragliding
short_description: Experience the freedom of flight over Himalayan valleys and coastal cliffs.
long_description:
Paragliding offers the closest experience to flying like a bird. It involves foot-launching from a hill or mountain slope while harnessed to a wide, canopy-like wing. Using rising currents of warm air (thermals) and wind, pilots can stay aloft for hours and cover vast distances.

In India, paragliding has grown from a niche sport to a major adventure attraction. The country boasts one of the world's best paragliding sites—Bir Billing in Himachal Pradesh—which hosted the Paragliding World Cup. But the sport isn't limited to the Himalayas; you can also glide over the lush Western Ghats in Kamshet, the endless plains of Gujarat, or the scenic tea gardens of Vagamon in Kerala.

Flights are generally categorized into two types: Tandem and Solo. For most tourists, Tandem flights are the way to go. You are strapped securely in front of an experienced, licensed pilot who handles all the controls, leaving you free to enjoy the panoramic views and take photos. For those seeking to master the skies themselves, accredited schools offer 15-day courses to learn solo flying.

The sensation is surprisingly peaceful. After a few energetic steps during takeoff, the ground falls away, and the wind rushes past as you soar silently. Whether it's the adrenaline of a high-altitude cross-country flight or a gentle sunset glide, paragliding is an unforgettable way to see India from a new perspective.

locations.summary: The 'Paragliding Capital of India', famous for being the world's second-highest site and offering long cross-country flights.
A favorite for Mumbaikars, offering stable ridge soaring conditions over Sahyadri hills and sunflowers fields.
Short but scenic flights over snow-capped peaks and pine forests, popular with tourists.
Gentle flights over shimmering lakes and green hills, ideal for first-timers.
Soar over lush green tea plantations and misty valleys in 'God's Own Country'.
High-altitude flights offering breathtaking views of the Kanchenjunga range.

entry_fees.notes: Green tax collected by local administration

opening_hours.time_notes: Flights are strictly weather dependent. Morning flights are smoother; afternoon flights have stronger thermals.

operating_season.season_notes: Bir Billing hosts the Paragliding World Cup in October/November.

pricing_metadata.disclaimer: Prices vary by season, flight duration, and operator negotiation.

safety_guidelines: Verify pilot's license (must be valid and carry ID).
Check equipment condition: harness should be secure, canopy should not have large tears.
Do not fly in rain, strong winds, or extremely cloudy conditions.
Wear ankle-supporting shoes to prevent injury during landing.
Follow pilot instructions strictly during takeoff run (don't sit down too early!).
Weight limit usually strictly enforced (Min 20kg, Max 95-105kg depending on wind).
equipment_checklist: Sturdy running shoes or trekking boots
Windcheater jacket (it gets cold up there)
GoPro (optional, usually provided for a fee)
Long pants (to protect legs during landing)
major_experiences: Running off a cliff edge to take off
Thermalling: circling upwards with eagles to gain height
Acrobatic maneuvers (Wing-overs and Spirals) if requested
Sunset glides with golden valley views
Landing in a designated meadow zone

sample_itinerary.one_day: Arrive at landing site by 9 AM. Take a jeep transfer (45 mins) to the takeoff point (Billing). Briefing by pilot. 15-30 minute flight landing at Bir. Lunch at a Tibetan cafe. Visit the monastery in the afternoon.
sample_itinerary.training: Day 1: Ground handling and canopy control. Day 2: Small hops from baby slopes. Day 3: Higher flights with radio guidance. Day 4-5: Solo flights from intermediate hills.

booking_methods: Directly with Pilot Associations (e.g., Billing Paragliding Association)
booking_details.suggested_stay: Bir features numerous backpacker hostels (Zostel, The Hosteller) and boutique homestays.
booking_details.how_to_reach: For Bir: Overnight Volvo bus from Delhi to Bir Road. Nearest airport is Dharamshala (Kangra) - 2 hours away.
